item.title: Preserving Memories: In Emails To A Toddler, A Window Into Her Parents' Love
item.description: April 10, 2017 - TO: Ava / FROM: Dad / SUBJECT: Your very first email ever! / "Hi Ava Bean! This is your dad (who is still getting use to that title) emailing you."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 10, 2017 - TO: Ava / FROM: Dad / SUBJECT: Your very first email ever! / "Hi Ava Bean! This is your dad (who is still getting use to that title) emailing you." http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/10/521594471/preserving-memories-in-emails-to-a-toddler-a-window-into-her-parents-love

item.title: Natural Gas Plant Makes A Play For Coal's Market, Using 'Clean' Technology
item.description: April 10, 2017 - The idea behind "clean coal" is technology that would capture for reuse most of the carbon dioxide emitted by coal-burning power plants. Entrepreneurs aim to use the same tech to clean natural gas.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 10, 2017 - The idea behind "clean coal" is technology that would capture for reuse most of the carbon dioxide emitted by coal-burning power plants. Entrepreneurs aim to use the same tech to clean natural gas. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/07/522662776/natural-gas-plant-makes-a-play-for-coals-market-using-clean-technology

item.title: Has Apple Lost Its Innovation Mojo?
item.description: April 10, 2017 - Apple was once considered the most innovative company in the tech sector. But by some accounts, it's being shown up by products from Amazon, Microsoft and now Samsung.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 10, 2017 - Apple was once considered the most innovative company in the tech sector. But by some accounts, it's being shown up by products from Amazon, Microsoft and now Samsung. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/10/523035456/has-apple-lost-its-innovation-mojo

item.title: Farmers Look For Ways To Circumvent Tractor Software Locks
item.description: April 9, 2017 - Fixing a modern tractor takes more than the right parts, but also the right software. Farmers are lobbying for the ability to buy that software, and some are hacking their way around the problem.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 9, 2017 - Fixing a modern tractor takes more than the right parts, but also the right software. Farmers are lobbying for the ability to buy that software, and some are hacking their way around the problem. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/09/523024776/farmers-look-for-ways-to-circumvent-tractor-software-locks

item.title: How Misinformation Spreads On The Internet And How To Stop It
item.description: April 9, 2017 - When tragic events happen, social media quickly fills with rumors and fake stories. NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks to Kate Starbird of the University of Washington about misinformation on the web.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 9, 2017 - When tragic events happen, social media quickly fills with rumors and fake stories. NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks to Kate Starbird of the University of Washington about misinformation on the web. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/09/523170115/how-misinformation-spreads-on-the-internet-and-how-to-stop-it

item.title: Reading The Game: Bioshock Infinite
item.description: April 9, 2017 - It's a simple premise — a guy, a girl, a gun and a debt to repay — but in Bioshock Infinite it becomes a mind-bending story about politics, oppression, change and sacrifice. Set in a flying city.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 9, 2017 - It's a simple premise — a guy, a girl, a gun and a debt to repay — but in Bioshock Infinite it becomes a mind-bending story about politics, oppression, change and sacrifice. Set in a flying city. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/09/523019414/reading-the-game-bioshock-infinite

item.title: What Is The Hatch Act? And What Does It Mean For Government Employees And Twitter?
item.description: April 8, 2017 - Last weekend, a Trump staffer was accused of violating the 1939 law barring federal employees from certain political activities. But the jury's still out over whether he actually did.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 8, 2017 - Last weekend, a Trump staffer was accused of violating the 1939 law barring federal employees from certain political activities. But the jury's still out over whether he actually did. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/08/523057689/what-is-the-hatch-act-and-what-does-it-mean-for-government-employees-and-twitter

item.title: Google Accused Of Underpaying Female Employees
item.description: April 8, 2017 - The U.S. Department of Labor is investigating Google for what an official called "systemic compensation disparities" between men and women. The government is suing the company to release its records.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 8, 2017 - The U.S. Department of Labor is investigating Google for what an official called "systemic compensation disparities" between men and women. The government is suing the company to release its records. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/08/523129221/google-accused-of-underpaying-female-employees

item.title: Taser Changes Its Name To Axon And Offers Free Body Cameras For Police
item.description: April 7, 2017 - Axon, which is the name of the company's line of body cameras, says it will send law enforcement agencies one body camera per sworn officer to use for a year.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 7, 2017 - Axon, which is the name of the company's line of body cameras, says it will send law enforcement agencies one body camera per sworn officer to use for a year. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/07/522878573/we-re-more-than-stun-guns-says-taser-as-it-changes-company-name

item.title: Twitter Withdraws Lawsuit After DHS Drops Demands For Alt-Account's Identity
item.description: April 7, 2017 - The social media giant alleged that the Department of Homeland Security was illegally trying to identify the anonymous @ALT_uscis account. In its latest filing, Twitter says the summons was withdrawn.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 7, 2017 - The social media giant alleged that the Department of Homeland Security was illegally trying to identify the anonymous @ALT_uscis account. In its latest filing, Twitter says the summons was withdrawn. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/07/523022497/twitter-withdraws-lawsuit-after-dhs-drops-demands-for-alt-accounts-identity

item.title: Morning News Brief: Trump Orders Syria Airstrikes, Hosts Chinese President
item.description: April 7, 2017 - President Trump says he ordered strikes against a Syrian air base in response to a chemical weapons attack ordered by Bashar Assad. Also, Trump met with China's President Xi Jinping.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 7, 2017 - President Trump says he ordered strikes against a Syrian air base in response to a chemical weapons attack ordered by Bashar Assad. Also, Trump met with China's President Xi Jinping. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/07/522968561/morning-news-brief-trump-orders-syria-airstrikes-hosts-chinese-president

item.title: Twitter Sues Homeland Security To Protect Anonymity Of 'Alt Immigration' Account
item.description: April 6, 2017 - After the Trump administration set limits on some government Twitter accounts, anonymous "rogue accounts" popped up. Homeland Security demanded to know who was behind one; Twitter is fighting back.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 6, 2017 - After the Trump administration set limits on some government Twitter accounts, anonymous "rogue accounts" popped up. Homeland Security demanded to know who was behind one; Twitter is fighting back. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/06/522914335/twitter-sues-homeland-security-to-protect-anonymity-of-alt-immigration-account

item.title: Comcast Goes Mobile With Cellphone Service For Existing Customers
item.description: April 6, 2017 - Comcast's new cellphone offer will use Verizon's wireless network and Comcast's own Wi-Fi hotspots. Xfinity Mobile offers prices that are generally cheaper than major wireless carriers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 6, 2017 - Comcast's new cellphone offer will use Verizon's wireless network and Comcast's own Wi-Fi hotspots. Xfinity Mobile offers prices that are generally cheaper than major wireless carriers. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/06/522851370/comcast-goes-mobile-with-cellphone-service-for-existing-customers

item.title: Amazon To Refund Millions In Unauthorized In-App Purchases
item.description: April 6, 2017 - The Federal Trade Commission sued Amazon and other companies after children racked up millions of dollars of in-app purchases without their parents' knowledge. The FTC and Amazon have dropped appeals.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 6, 2017 - The Federal Trade Commission sued Amazon and other companies after children racked up millions of dollars of in-app purchases without their parents' knowledge. The FTC and Amazon have dropped appeals. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/06/522826507/amazon-to-refund-millions-in-unauthorized-in-app-purchases

item.title: Are We Witnessing The Beginning Of The End For Free Music Streaming?
item.description: April 5, 2017 - Spotify has long evangelized free listening as a way to pull users in to paying for its service. The music industry's patience with the strategy seems to have run out.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 5, 2017 - Spotify has long evangelized free listening as a way to pull users in to paying for its service. The music industry's patience with the strategy seems to have run out. http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/04/05/522762634/are-we-witnessing-the-beginning-of-the-end-for-free-music-streaming
